thread.title: Reality star Miller indicted on bankruptcy fraud
thread.title_full: Reality star Miller indicted on bankruptcy fraud

title: Reality star Miller indicted on bankruptcy fraud
text:
Reality star Miller indicted on bankruptcy fraud 1:36am BST - 00:53 
TV star Abby Lee Miller, known from the reality show ''Dance Moms,'' has been indicted on bankruptcy fraud and other federal charges. John Russell reports. ▲ Hide Transcript ▶ View Transcript 
Reality TV show star Abby Lee Miller has been indicted on bankruptcy fraud and other federal charges for concealing income she earned on "Dance Moms" and related spinoff shows, the U.S. Attorney's Office announced on Wednesday (October 14). A federal grand jury on Tuesday returned a 20-count indictment against Miller, 50, on charges of bankruptcy fraud, concealment of bankruptcy assets, and false bankruptcy declarations. She will be arraigned on Nov. 5 in U.S. District Court in Pittsburgh. If convicted, she faces up to five years in prison and a 250,000 dollar (USD) fine for each count. Miller had filed a petition to reorganize her dance studio, Abby Lee Dance Company in December 2010. "Dance Moms," on the Lifetime television network, currently in its fifth season, exposes the lives of competitive young dancers, including the tensions between their parents and Miller.
